Description:
SummaryTo provide leadership, direction, and technical expertise in the field of mechanical engineering for ENOWA power generation projects encompassing solar, wind, geothermal, thermal (grid-connected), and off-grid power generation. The Senior Manager - Mechanical will play a pivotal role in the design, construction, and operation phases, ensuring that all mechanical systems and components align with the highest standards of safety, quality, and efficiency.Key Accountabilities and ResponsibilitiesEngineering management      Lead the development of the mechanical engineering design based on project requirements.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate the mechanical systems within the broader project infrastructure.
Develop and review engineering standards, specifications, and best practices for the mechanical domain.
Oversee the procurement, installation, and commissioning of mechanical equipment and systems.
Liaise with contractors and suppliers to ensure alignment with project specifications.
Troubleshoot and address any mechanical issues that arise during construction.
Monitor and supervise the operation of all mechanical systems within the power generation facility.
Implement regular maintenance schedules and oversee repair activities to ensure continuous operation.
Implement innovation and best practices to enhance efficiency and reliability.
Ensure all mechanical systems and procedures comply with local, national, and international safety and environmental standards.
Regularly conduct safety audits and promote a culture of safety within the mechanical team and the broader organization.
Manage a diverse team of mechanical engineers, technicians, and other professionals.
Provide mentoring and professional development opportunities for team members.
Drive performance standards and set clear objectives for the team.
Communicate with internal and external stakeholders including regulatory bodies, suppliers, and contractors.
Provide periodic reports and updates to senior management and other stakeholders on the progress of mechanical engineering activities.Background, SkillsIn-depth understanding of thermal and renewable power generation technologies.
Proven experience in overseeing large-scale power generation projects from design to operation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate complex technical information to a range of audiences.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities in managing large interdisciplinary teams.
Sound understanding of local and international safety and environmental standards related to power generation.
Outstanding problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical and logistical challenges.
Highly effective communication skills to liaise with internal teams, external partners, and regulatory authorities.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong leadership skills and ability to work independently and in a team.
Travels to project sites as needed.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering; a Master’s degree would be an added advantage.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in power generation projects/operations, with at least 5 years in a senior managerial role.
Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, PE, CEng) or equivalent.
Additional certifications or training related to renewable energy technologies would be beneficial.Job Details
